fractals.name: Sierpinski Triangle
fractals.description: A classic fractal formed by repeatedly moving halfway toward a randomly chosen vertex of a triangle.

fractals.name: Chaos Game - Square
fractals.description: Using four vertices of a square, we move halfway toward a random vertex but avoid repeating the same one consecutively.

fractals.name: Barnsley Fern
fractals.description: A fractal resembling a natural fern, generated using four affine transformations with specific probabilities.

fractals.name: Koch Snowflake
fractals.description: A recursive fractal formed by repeatedly subdividing each line segment into four parts and replacing the middle one with two sides of an equilateral triangle.
formulas: Each iteration replaces each segment with 4 smaller segments at 60° angles.

fractals.name: Dragon Curve
fractals.description: A self-similar fractal formed by repeatedly folding a strip of paper and unfolding it at right angles.
formulas: Turn left, draw, turn right, draw.

fractals.name: Pythagoras Tree
fractals.description: A plane fractal constructed from squares, each spawning two smaller squares at 45° angles.
formulas: Spawn two smaller squares at the top corners rotated ±45°.

fractals.name: Hilbert Curve
fractals.description: A continuous fractal space-filling curve that passes through every point in a grid once.

fractals.name: Mandelbrot Set
fractals.description: A famous fractal defined in the complex plane by iterating z = z² + c and determining whether the sequence remains bounded.
